radiographic_examinations.findings: Nodular consolidation in the right lower lung that was suggestive of pneumonia.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Persistent, nodular opacities in the right mid lung; new hazy pulmonary opacities developed in both lungs.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Faint ground-glass nodular opacities, most prominent in the lower lungs; no mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy; normal heart size and pulmonary arteries.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Increase in the size, attenuation, and number of ground-glass nodular opacities, with areas of confluence in a peribronchovascular distribution.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Marked increase in ground-glass nodular opacities that were most prominent in the lower lungs; areas of confluence developed in a peribronchovascular distribution.

Marked progression of ground-glass nodular opacities in both lungs; many opacities became confluent with prominent clustering around the bronchovascular bundles; no primary airway disease or fibrosis.
